column1: image:Bird_and_Baby_Inn_sign.jpgThe Bird and Baby Inn is Michel Delvings major hub of social activity
column2: and the largest tavern in the Shire. Weary travelers can indulge in food and drink
column3: and share stories of adventures by the fire. The Bird and Baby also offers the services of a barber and healer.

column1: The Bird and Baby Inn did not appear in the books of the Lord of the Rings trilogy. The inclusion of a tavern named "Bird and Baby" is a reference to the real-world tavern Eagle and Child in Oxford
column2: England which was frequented by the members of The Inklings.

column1: Students of Oxford University who frequent the Eagle and Child often refer to the tavern as the Bird and Baby (among other colorful names).
Category:The Lord of the Rings Online structures
